intro: Leichhardtia flavida, commonly known as the yellow leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in rainforests or along riverbanks.
